details.title: oHealthCxt-Browser
details.description: This browser is a complementary part of an extension named Bifrost that aims to connect Widgets with Cosmos instances in order to display historical data over mashups

preference.name: ngsi_server
preference.label: IP
preference.description: URL of the Remote/Cosmos instance to use for retrieving entity information

preference.name: health_module
preference.label: Module
preference.description: Define one of the available modules for this browser (e.g., Participants, PhysicalTest, VariableOfInterest)

preference.name: use_user_fiware_token
preference.label: Use FIWARE credentials
preference.description: Use the FIWARE credentials of the user logged into WireCloud. Take into account this option cannot be enabled if you want to use this widget in a public workspace as anonoymous users doesn't have a valid FIWARE auth token

preference.name: ngsi_tenant
preference.label: NGSI service
preference.description: Tenant/service to use when connecting to the context broker. Must be a string of alphanumeric characters (lowercase) and the "_" symbol. Maximum length is 50 characters. If empty, the default tenant will be used

preference.name: ngsi_service_path
preference.label: NGSI scope
preference.description: Scope/path to use when connecting to the context broker. Must be a string of alphanumeric characters (lowercase) and the "_" symbol separated by "/" slashes. Maximum length is 50 characters. If empty, the default service path will be used: /

preference.name: ngsi_entities
preference.label: NGSI entity types
preference.description: A comma separated list of entity types to use for filtering entities from the Orion Context broker. Leave this field empty for no filtering by type.

preference.name: extra_attributes
preference.label: Attributes
preference.description: Comma separated list of attributes to be displayed in the widget as extra columns
